content.raw:
> the behavior has been changed to overwrite existing directory

You're right, it was changed on pull request #413. I think the intended use case was when the user intentionally wants to overwrite, but I think it's also useful to support creating a new numbered directory.

> If zipping takes forever, then maybe people don’t want the program to run forever

That's a good point. How about adding a flag so the user can enable zipping. In case zipping is enabled, we delete the original directory in the end. So we never end up with both the zip and the dir. What do you think?

> Does this have to do with the model:// and file:// differences?

Yeah I think so.
